title: Regression: Incorrect architecture field value while packaging .deb for arm64
body:
### What happened?

.deb package file has incorrect suffix and corresponding `Architecture` field in debian metadata.

### How can we reproduce this?

Given the `.goreleaser.yaml` file:

```yaml
builds:
  - id: my-bin
    binary: my-bin
    env:
      - CGO_ENABLED=0
    goos:
      - darwin
      - linux
    goarch:
      - amd64
      - arm
      - arm64
 nfpms:
  - package_name: my-bin
    file_name_template: "{{ .ConventionalFileName }}"
    formats:
      - deb
```

And a commmand:  `goreleaser --snapshot --clean` which yields among other the following output:

```bash
  • linux packages
    • creating                                       package=my-bin format=deb arch=arm64v8.0 file=dist/my-bin_0.0.0~SNAPSHOT-none_arm64v8.0.deb
    • creating                                       package=my-bin format=deb arch=arm6 file=dist/my-bin_0.0.0~SNAPSHOT-none_armhf.deb
    • creating                                       package=my-bin format=deb arch=amd64v1 file=dist/my-bin_0.0.0~SNAPSHOT-none_amd64.deb
```

If we unpack `dist/my-bin_0.0.0~gitnone_arm64v8.0.deb` to inspect Debian metadata, we'll see erroneous value of `Architecture` field:

```
Package: my-bin
Version: 0.0.0~SNAPSHOT-none
Section:
Priority: optional
Architecture: arm64v8.0
```

Per [Debian wiki](https://wiki.debian.org/SupportedArchitectures) correct value is `arm64`
